World Wildlife Fund pulls conservation-focused NFT project after backlash@theblock__1/11/2022

Users accused the WWF UK of "greenwashing" and harming endangered animals through their conservation-focused NFT drop.

conservation, environmental, NFT, World Wildlife Fund, WWF, WWF UKRead

<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We thank all of those who have generously supported our conservation work by purchasing NFTs, the WWF UK wrote. We have now agreed with our partners to bring this trial to a close this evening (Friday 4th February). We recognise that NFTs are a much debated issue and we all have lots to learn about this new market, which is why we will now fully assess the impact of this trial and reflect on how we can best continue to innovate to engage our supporters.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The launch was originally slated to occur on February 3. The NFTs represented 13 endangered animal species such as the giant panda, Galapagos penguin and cross river gorilla. The collection included about 7,900 NFTs, which corresponded to the actual number of living members of each species in the wild.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The NFTs cost between 0.05 ETH (about $150) to 0.25 ETH (about $750) to mint, according to the projects Discord, and were to be minted on Polygon, a scaling chain for the Ethereum blockchain.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">However, the UKs WWF pulled the mint early after experiencing immense user backlash. Some on Discord accused the WWF of greenwashing this project with half truths about side chains, citing the </span><a href="https://www.theblockcrypto.com/news+/107461/the-carbon-footprint-of-nfts"><span style="font-weight: 400;">energy cost</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> of dirty ETH for NFTs.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Others on Twitter said, Even if this particular arrangement was eco-friendly (it isnt), youre still contributing to the widespread adoption of NFT use which is literally killing the planet and the animals youre purporting to protect.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Some did come to the WWF UKs defense. Had this been a physical canvas art sale for these animals I don't think anyone would have had an issue. But because it's digital art people were attacking it on twitter because they don't like and understand crypto. I think WWF were a bit ahead of the curve here, and probably poor marketing/hype around it, a Discord user wrote.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">This is not the first time a branch of the WWF sold NFTs to benefit conservation efforts. As The Block previously </span><a href="https://www.theblockcrypto.com/linked/121691/germanys-world-wildlife-fund-to-sell-nfts-to-raise-money-for-endangered-species"><span style="font-weight: 400;">reported</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">, WWF Germany sold NFTs corresponding to the actual numbers of endangered animals in October of 2021. </span></p></div> <div Protocol";by.slug="router-protocol-integrates-avalanche-to-its-cross-chain-messaging-protocol";by.label=P;by.published="2022-03-04T09:00:25-05:00";by.publishedFormatted="March 4, 2022, 9:00AM EST";by.byLines="by \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Fauthor\u002Fsponsored\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ESponsored\u003C\u002Fa\u003E";by.authors=[{id:w,name:P,thumbnail:"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tbstat.com\u002Fwp\u002Fuploads\u002F2019\u002F09\u002FGSuite-logo.jpg",url:"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Fauthor\u002Fsponsored",slug:aY}];by.thumbnail="https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tbstat.com\u002Fwp\u002Fuploads\u002F2022\u002F03\u002Fposts-20-1200x675.png";by.thumbnailCredit=a;by.thumbnailCaption=a;by.intro=a;by.excerpt="Router Protocol - an infrastructure layer enabling communication between blockchains, today announced that it has integrated Avalanche networks C-Chain to its cross-chain messaging protocol.";by.body="\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003ERouter Protocol - \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003Ean infrastructure layer enabling communication between blockchains,\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E today announced that it has integrated Avalanche networks C-Chain to its cross-chain messaging protocol. Users now have the ability to utilize the true potential of the Avalanche network by performing cross-chain transfers and swaps between Polygon, Binance Smart Chain (BSC), and Avalanche C-chain.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EAvalanches integration marks a significant step forward for Router and advances our mission of achieving a multi-blockchain future, said Ramani Ramachandran, co-founder and chief executive of Router Protocol.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EAs blockchain ecosystems continue to grow, they are becoming increasingly siloed and unconnected from each other, preventing the industry from reaching its full potential.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cb\u003EWhats currently available on the Router?\u003C\u002Fb\u003E \u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EA \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cb\u003Eproprietary pathfinder algorithm\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E that aggregates DEXes to find the best rates for cross-chain swaps. On the Avalanche side, Router plugs into Trader Joe and Pangolintwo of the most liquid DEXes on the networkto power cross-chain swaps. Router is plugged into multiple AMMs, including PancakeSwap on BSC and Dfyn, SushiSwap, and QuickSwap exchange on Polygon.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\"\u003E\u003Cb\u003ESeamless cross-chain swaps\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E: Avalanche eco-system users can buy digital assets on Polygon or BSC in a single transaction without leaving the Avalanche network. Similarly, users from Polygon or BSC can buy any Avalanche ecosystem tokens without leaving the respective chains. \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\"\u003E\u003Cb\u003E1:1 low-fees asset transfer\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E of assets like USDC, AVAX. MATIC, and BNB. \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\"\u003E\u003Cb\u003EFast finality\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E: Settlement for most transactions is less than one minute.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EThe news comes following Routers mainnet launch on Polygon and Binance Smart Chain (BSC) in January after raising $4.1 million from leading investors including Coinbase Ventures, Alameda Research, QCP, Polygon, and Wintermute.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003E\u003Cb\u003EWhats coming next for Router:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cb\u003EMore EVM chains:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E Router Protocol is going to cover almost all major EVM chains.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cb\u003ECross Chain Explorer:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E An explorer to see exactly how cross-chain transfers and swaps happen on different chains. This will give users more transparency and make debugging easier.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cb\u003EIncentivized staking & liquidity mining programs\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E: Router will create various staking and liquidity mining programs for rewarding those who provide liquidity to Router bridge.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cb\u003ERouter Software Developer Kit (SDK)\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E: Currently scheduled for May 2022, the SDK will include tools for developers to utilize Routers cross-chain messaging system to build cross-chain dapps. Instead of dApps that function on multiple chains separately, developers will be able to build dApps that use multiple chains in tandem.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cb\u003ENon-EVM chain:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E Router will introduce its first non-EVM chain in the second quarter of 2022.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cb\u003ERouter V2 Prototype:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E A prototype of the Router blockchain designed as a cross-chain first blockchain with a focus on enabling messaging across chains.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cb\u003EMore Validators:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E Router Protocol will onboard new validators and then transition to a model where anyone can become a validator.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EFor more information about Router Protocol and its mission to revolutionize cross-chain interoperability visit \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.routerprotocol.com\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003Ewww.routerprotocol.com.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cb\u003EAbout Router Protocol\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003ERouter Protocol is building a suite of cross-chain liquidity infra primitives that aims to seamlessly provide bridging infrastructure between current and emerging Layer 1 and Layer 2 blockchain solutions.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\"\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan class=\"font-body font-size-7;\"\u003E 2022 The Block Crypto, Inc. U-Zyn Chua.";bP.body="\u003Cp\u003ECake DeFi launched a new corporate venture arm on Wednesday, loaded with $100 million in fresh funding intended \u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400\"\u003Eto accelerate the growth of web3, gaming and fintech firms.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThe Singapore-based fintech platform said in a release that Cake DeFi Ventures (CDV) \u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400\"\u003Ewill look for global investment opportunities in startups across the world.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThe fund will be led by Cake DeFi co-founders \u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400\"\u003EJulian Hosp and U-Zyn Chua.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400\"\u003EWith Cake's current status as Singapore's and Southeast Asia's fastest-growing platform, projects which we invest in can expect to receive strong support scaling globally, said Hosp.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003ECake DeFi has grown rapidly over the past year, increasing its user base by 10 times by the end of 2021. It said that much of this growth took place in the fourth quarter, when confirmed users almost doubled.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThe fund has already led its first investment in a media, events and tech venture called The Edge of Company. It did not disclose the terms of the deal.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EIt joins a frothy and sharp-elbowed market for crypto and web3 project funding. A number of large players have announced big funds in recent months, including \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Fnews+\u002F126612\u002Fcrypto-vc-funding-roundup-november-blockchain-gaming-nft\"\u003EParadigm's $2.5 billion fund\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, FTX's $2 billion venture fund,\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Fnews+\u002F133292\u002Fjanuary-crypto-vc-roundup-record-breaking-month-nearly-5-billion-investments\"\u003Eand Pantera Capital's\u003C\u002Fa\u003E$1 billion ";bZ.body="\u003Cp\u003EGoldman Sachs is connecting clients with Galaxy Digital's Institutional Ethereum Fund, according to documents filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EAn amended \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.sec.gov\u002FArchives\u002Fedgar\u002Fdata\u002F1848662\u002F000184866222000002\u002FxslFormDX01\u002Fprimary_doc.xml\"\u003EForm D\u003C\u002Fa\u003E filing from Galaxy Digital indicates that Goldman Sachs receives an introduction fee for delivering clients to the Galaxy Institutional Ethereum Fund.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\"Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC will receive an introduction fee with respect to certain clients introduced to Issuer,\" says the filing.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EIn January of 2021, Galaxy Digital announced it would launch \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Fpost\u002F92400\u002Fgalaxy-digital-eth-funds-institutions\"\u003Ea suite of Ethereum funds\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, including this institutional offering. To date, the Institutional Ethereum Fund has sold over $50.5 million over 28 investors, according to the Form D. The minimum investment is $250,000.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EGalaxy Digital has an existing partnership with Goldman Sachs in the form of a liquidity agreement. The crypto firm has been a \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Flinked\u002F108956\u002Fgalaxy-digital-goldman-sachs-bitcoin-futures\"\u003Eliquidity provider\u003C\u002Fa\u003E for Goldman's bitcoin futures block trades since June of target=\"_blank\"\u003EShutterstock\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E";cb.thumbnailCaption=a;cb.intro=a;cb.excerpt="The former P2P file sharing service says its new iteration will allow fans and artists to create, buy and trade digital collectables.";cb.body="\u003Cp\u003EPeer-to-peer file sharing platform LimeWire is set to relaunch in May as a digital collectibles marketplace for art, entertainment and music.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThe platform  which gained notoriety in the 2000s as a place to download music and other files outside of mainstream channels  will initially focus on music-linked NFTs, LimeWire said in a release today. Its new iteration will allow fans and artists to create, buy and trade digital collectables without the current technical hurdles of the NFT landscape.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EMusic-related assets will include limited editions, pre-release songs, unreleased demos, graphical artwork, exclusive live versions, as well as digital merchandise and backstage content.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003ELimeWire said it's\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003Eaiming to combine the user experience of web2 with the benefits of web3. I\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003Et plans launch its own token later this year, allowing access to exclusive content and community voting.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EThere is no crypto wallet prerequisite, and users will be able to purchase collectibles directly via credit card, bank transfer and other fiat gateways thanks to a close partnership with payment platform Wyre. Items will be priced in US dollars.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EBack in 2010, LimeWire was served with an injunction in the US which aimed to block \"the searching, downloading, uploading, file trading and\u002For file distribution functionality, and\u002For all functionality.\" In its resurrected form, the company aims to onboard 1 million users within its first year through partnerships with musicians. The \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Flimewire.com\u002Fwaitlist\"\u003Ewaiting list\u003C\u002Fa\u003E is already open.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThis is the latest in a host of projects to try to take advantage of new ways to generate revenue from collectables linked to music. Earlier this month, \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Fpost\u002F136095\u002Fbillboard-and-universal-music-group-partner-to-launch-nft-project\"\u003EBillboard and Universal Music Group\u003C\u002Fa\u003E said they are partnering to launch ChartStars\u003Cem\u003E,\u003C\u002Fem\u003Ean NFT based project of digital collectibles built on the Flow blockchain.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E";cb.primaryCategory={name:C,url:aZ};cb.categories=[{name:C,slug:ap,taxonomy:p},{name:"Web3",slug:"web3",taxonomy:p}];cb.tags=[{name:"LimeWire",slug:"limewire",taxonomy:k},{name:a_,slug:cc,taxonomy:k}];cb.userHasAccess=o;cb.isSponsored=l;cb.sponsor=w;cb.wordCount=281;cb.readingTime=J;cb.customFields={display_title:o};cd.id=136877;cd.url="https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Flinked\u002F136877\u002Fex-robinhood-employees-launch-money-transfer-fintech-atlantic-money";cd.type=G;cd.title="Ex-Robinhood employees launch money transfer fintech Atlantic Money";cd.slug="ex-robinhood-employees-launch-money-transfer-fintech-atlantic-money";cd.label=a;cd.published="2022-03-09T03:32:13-05:00";cd.publishedFormatted="March 9, 2022, 3:32AM EST";cd.byLines="by \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Fauthor\u002Ftom-matsuda\"\u003ETom Matsuda\u003C\u002Fa\u003E";cd.authors=[{id:7213,name:"Tom Matsuda",thumbnail:w,url:"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Fauthor\u002Ftom-matsuda",slug:"tom-matsuda"}];cd.thumbnail="https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tbstat.com\u002Fwp\u002Fuploads\u002F2022\u002F03\u002FWebp.net-resizeimage-2-1200x675.jpg";cd.thumbnailCredit=a;cd.thumbnailCaption=a;cd.intro=a;cd.excerpt="Atlantic Money, a money transfer fintech founded by former Robinhood employees Neeraj Baid and Patrick Kavanagh, has emerged from stealth.";cd.body="\u003Cp\u003EAtlantic Money, a money transfer fintech founded by former Robinhood employees Neeraj Baid and Patrick Kavanagh, emerged from stealth today, pitching itself as a second-generation challenger to Wise, PayPal and Revolut.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EWhile at Robinhood, both Baid and Kavanagh were involved in the US broker's international projects, where they were tasked with researching expansion into Europe. Although Robinhood ultimately decided to \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftechcrunch.com\u002F2020\u002F07\u002F21\u002Frobinhood-uk-shutters\"\u003Eabandon\u003C\u002Fa\u003E its UK launch, the two say this experience was what ultimately sparked an interest in launching a remittance fintech catering to the UK market.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EAt launch, the service will initially be available to UK residents looking to move sums of 1000 to 1 million to nine other currencies  including US dollars, Australian dollars and euros.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EIn the crowded UK money transfer market, they say that their product stands out as it's focused on doing one job well  \"we're not interested in building a super-app,\" Baid says  and has a fixed fee of 3. The founders say they're able to do this by connecting their customers to an institutional-grade currency transfer solution via its app.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\"Our fees are low,\" Baid said in an interview. \"Especially if you get into the 1000s you're looking at 50-80% savings compared to anybody else in the market, which is something we're incredibly proud of  we're also profitable on every transfer.\"\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003ELooking to crypto\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EHaving worked on Robinhood Crypto  Baid says he was the deciding force behind putting dogecoin on the platform  Kavanagh says they can imagine a world in which they would consider expanding to include crypto. Competitor TransferGo \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Fnews+\u002F127472\u002Fdefi-could-solve-the-last-mile-problem-for-remittances-says-transfergo-ceo\"\u003Epreviously told The Block\u003C\u002Fa\u003E that it looked at stablecoin transfers for business-to-business use cases in Africa.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\"One of the first questions we have is can crypto make money transfer faster, cheaper and easier. The answer from the research we have so far is: not yet\" says Kavanagh. \"But we're tool-agnostic, so if crypto solves the problem we're happy to do it.\"\u003C\u002Fp\u003E";cd.primaryCategory={name:ce,url:"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Fcategory\u002Ffintech"};cd.categories=[{name:ce,slug:"fintech",taxonomy:p}];cd.tags=[{name:"money \"the first ever, whole-of-government approach to addressing the risks and harnessing the potential benefits of digital assets and their underlying technology.\"";ch.body="\u003Cp\u003EA much-anticipated executive order from President Joseph Biden is scheduled to drop at 6:00 AM EST, according to a fact sheet reviewed by The Block.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThe fact sheet describes the order as \"outlining the first ever, whole-of-government approach to addressing the risks and harnessing the potential benefits of digital assets and their underlying technology.\"\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThe document, shown in full below, was leaked to The Block. It is labeled as under embargo for 6:00 AM EST, an agreement to which The Block was never a party.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Flinked\u002F136813\u002Fbiden-reportedly-set-to-order-multi-agency-study-push-on-crypto-cbdcs\"\u003EPer earlier reporting\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, the order is fairly benign, despite early fears of a pending crackdown. It does, however, emphasize an all-of-government approach, calling on new work from the Treasury, Financial Stability Oversight Council, Federal Reserve and national security agencies on relevant portions of the crypto ecosystem.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EA \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Flinked\u002F136883\u002Fjanet-yellen-says-bidens-crypto-executive-order-supports-responsible-innovation\"\u003Estatement from Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen\u003C\u002Fa\u003E on the new executive order seems to have gone up accidentally on the Treasury's website before being taken down, but not before its webarchive was captured. Like the fact sheet, Yellen emphasized coordination, as well as the existing basis of agency interest in crypto, saying, \"This work will complement ongoing efforts by Treasury.\"\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"alignnone size-full wp-image-136898\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tbstat.com\u002Fwp\u002Fuploads\u002F2022\u002F03\u002FExecutive-order-1.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"1081\" height=\"1398\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"alignnone size-full wp-image-136901\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tbstat.com\u002Fwp\u002Fuploads\u002F2022\u002F03\u002FExecutive-order-2.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"1081\" height=\"1396\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\"\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan class=\"font-body font-size-7;\"\u003E 2022 The Block Crypto, Inc. McSweeney",thumbnail:"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tbstat.com\u002Fwp\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F10\u002FMcSweeney-300x300.jpg",url:"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Fauthor\u002Fmichael-mcsweeney",slug:"michael-mcsweeney"}];cm.thumbnail="https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tbstat.com\u002Fwp\u002Fuploads\u002F2021\u002F11\u002F20211101_Janet-Yellen-1200x675.jpg";cm.thumbnailCredit=a;cm.thumbnailCaption=a;cm.intro=a;cm.excerpt="A now-deleted statement from US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen lays out how her department will implement the provisions of a long-awaited executive order from Joe Biden's White House.";cm.body="\u003Cp\u003EA new statement from US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen lays out how her department will implement the provisions of a long-awaited executive order from Joe Biden's White House.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThe \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fhome.treasury.gov\u002Fnews\u002Fpress-releases\u002Fjy0643\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"\u003Estatement\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, issued late Tuesday and later removed (archived version \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fweb.archive.org\u002Fweb\u002F20220309014601\u002Fhttps:\u002F\u002Fhome.treasury.gov\u002Fnews\u002Fpress-releases\u002Fjy0643\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"\u003Ehere\u003C\u002Fa\u003E) from the department's website, states that \"Bidens historic executive order calls for a coordinated and comprehensive approach to digital asset policy.\"\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\"This approach will support responsible innovation that could result in substantial benefits for the nation, consumers, and businesses,\" Yellen continued. \"It will also address risks related to illicit finance, protecting consumers and investors, and preventing threats to the financial system and broader economy.\"\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EPer Yellen's statement, the Treasury Department \"will partner with interagency colleagues to produce a report on the future of money and payment systems.\" Treasury will also \"convene the Financial Stability Oversight Council to evaluate the potential financial stability risks of digital assets and assess whether appropriate safeguards are in place\" and \"work with our international partners to promote robust standards and a level playing field\" given the global nature of the industry.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\"This work will complement ongoing efforts by Treasury,\" Yellen continued.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Flinked\u002F136813\u002Fbiden-reportedly-set-to-order-multi-agency-study-push-on-crypto-cbdcs\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"\u003ERecent reports\u003C\u002Fa\u003E have indicated that the Biden EO will have several components, all of which are centered around studying cryptocurrency and digital money across multiple US government departments and agencies. Specific topics include central bank digital currency and the environmental impact of cryptocurrencies.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\"As we take on this important work, well be guided by consumer and investor protection groups, market participants, and other leading experts,\" Yellen's statement concluded. \"Treasury will work to promote a fairer, more inclusive, and more efficient financial system, while building on our ongoing work to counter illicit finance, and prevent risks to financial stability and national security.\"\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cem\u003EHat tip \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002Fthebluematt\u002Fstatus\u002F1501376145803001857?s=21\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"\u003EMatt three units of Sequoia Capital join EthSign's $12 million funding round in first such deal";co.slug="ethsign-crypto-funding-sequoia-capital-all-three-units";co.label=ar;co.published="2022-03-08T19:30:56-05:00";co.publishedFormatted="March 8, 2022, 7:30PM EST";co.byLines="by \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Fauthor\u002Fyogita-khatri\"\u003EYogita Khatri\u003C\u002Fa\u003E";co.authors=[{id:294,name:"Yogita Khatri",thumbnail:"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tbstat.com\u002Fwp\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F07\u002FYogita-Kathri@0.5x-300x300.jpg",url:"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Fauthor\u002Fyogita-khatri",slug:"yogita-khatri"}];co.thumbnail="https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tbstat.com\u002Fwp\u002Fuploads\u002F2022\u002F03\u002F20220302_Funding_Roundup-1200x675.jpg";co.thumbnailCredit=a;co.thumbnailCaption=a;co.intro=cp;co.excerpt="EthSign has raised $12 million in a seed funding round and all three units of the Sequoia VC have backed the round.";co.body="\u003Cp\u003EWeb3 infrastructure startup EthSign has raised $12 million in a seed funding round and all three units of the Sequoia VC  Sequoia Capital, Sequoia Capital India and Sequoia Capital China  have backed its round.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThis is the first time all three units of Sequoia have participated in a funding round in general, and not just in the crypto space, a Sequoia Capital India spokesperson told The Block. A Sequoia Capital spokesperson also separately confirmed that this is the first time all three units are in a single round.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003ESequoia Capital India co-led EthSign's seed round along with Mirana Ventures. Other investors in the round included Amber Group, Circle Ventures, NGC Ventures, HashKey Group, and Matrixport. Angel investors including Balaji Srinivasan, Tegan Kline (The Graph), Sandeep Nailwal (Polygon), Sid Powell (Maple Finance) and Thomas Vu (Riot Games), also backed the round.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EEthSign raised the funds via a simple agreement for future tokens (SAFT) sale, its co-founder Potter Li told The Block in an interview. Sequoia Capital India first committed to the round. Then it referred the deal to Sequoia Capital, and Li personally knew Sequoia China executives, so that's how all three units got onboarded, said Li.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EEthSign is like a decentralized version of DocuSign, according to Li. It allows users to sign and manage agreements electronically. Users can log in to EthSign via crypto wallets such as MetaMask, upload documents, and electronically sign it.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003ETo move a step further, EthSign is now planning to launch an execution platform called Smart Agreements. It will allow users to execute signed agreements via smart contracts based on predetermined conditions. \"Smart Agreement is a self-executable contract with escrow funds. You can preset conditions, predeposit funds in an escrow account, and if those conditions are met, escrow funds will be released to a concerned party,\" explained Li.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThe EthSign Smart Agreements platform is slated to launch in the third quarter of this year.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EEthSign currently does not charge for its services, but it plans to levy a tax on escrow transactions once the execution platform is launched, said Li. Its current users include MetaMask and Amber Group.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThere are currently 15 people working for EthSign and Li along with his two co-founders Xin Yan and Jack Xu plans to increase the team size to about 25 people in the near future.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EEventually, EthSign intends to turn into a decentralized autonomous organization and launch its own token. \"Right now, we are focused on building great products and have our network effect,\" said Li.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThe seed round brings EthSign's total funding to date to $12.65 million. The startup previously raised $650,000 in a pre-seed round early last year.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\"\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan class=\"font-body font-size-7;\"\u003E 2022 The Block Crypto, Inc. ";cq.intro=cs;cq.excerpt="The Block spoke with Leslie Alessandra, who sold her home in February in a transaction involving an NFT. ";cq.body="\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cem\u003EPictured above: The Florida property sold last month in an NFT-tied transaction.\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003ELast month, The Block \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Flinked\u002F134006\u002Fpropys-sale-of-nft-tied-florida-home-nets-over-650k\"\u003Ecovered\u003C\u002Fa\u003E the sale of a home that sold in Florida through Propy, a real estate blockchain company. The home netted over $650,000, and was tied to an NFT that authenticated the sale and the rightful owner.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThe Block caught up with the seller of the property, Leslie Alessandra, to learn more about the sale and the process involved.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cem\u003EThe interview has been edited for clarity and length.\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAnushree Dave:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003EWhat prompted you to sell a property backed by an NFT? Why not just sell it the regular old-school way that we all do now?\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ELeslie Alessandra: \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003ESo Im a real estate investor. I've been investing in real estate for several years now with long-term holds and fix-and-flips. And then a couple years ago, I kind of fell down the crypto rabbit hole, and just could not get enough of learning about crypto and blockchain technology. So much so that my cousin and I opened up DeFi unlimited, a crypto company that helps traditional businesses move on to the blockchain. So we really started off as a small crypto company just trying to help small businesses start to accept cryptocurrency for payments, or to use NFT for marketing.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EAnd what we realized is that there was a real gap in the knowledge base of the average person on crypto and blockchain and the benefits of blockchain. And so, we realize most people when they thought of NFTs, they just thought of the sale of Beeple, the artwork that sold for multi-million dollars. But they didn't understand the practical use of the technology. So, I was talking to my cousin, and I said, why don't we consider selling this property as an NFT? And, that way we can show people, a practical example in real estate because everyone at some point in their life is either going to buy or sell a piece of property.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAD:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003EHow did you get in touch with Propy to use their platform?\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ELA: \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003ESo we were going to do it ourselves. But then we ended up going to the Bitcoin Conference, which is where we met [Propy CEO] Natalia. She had mentioned that she had an auction platform already set up. So we decided to partner with her.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAD:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E What did it cost you?\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ELA: \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003EYeah, to be honest, it was relatively expensive for me, because this is the first-time Propys really done this in the United States. When you're the first to do something, you don't really know what the issues are going to be until you're in kind of in the thick of it working through them. So the fees that I paid to Propy  and these are separate from other fees  I paid $3,700 for them to mint the NFT. We were going to mint it, but they already had a minting platform and we just had decided that once we committed to partner with them, we would use their platform. So, they minted it for $3,700, something like that.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAD:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E Is that a fixed rate or was that based on something, like the cost of your home?\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ELA: \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003EI believe that was a fixed rate. And then there was a $5,000 marketing fee for them to market the property. And then, they told me they were going to do a 1% of the sale price, but towards the end when we were about to go to the office, they changed that and said that it would be a $6,000 flat fee, just for handling the whole auction process.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAD:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E So it cost a total of $14,700 to list and market the property?\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ELA:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E Well, I also decided, because I really wanted to be protected myself and make sure that I wasn't putting myself in any kind of legal issues, I hired a real estate attorney to represent me as well throughout the process. So, I paid that out of my own pocketSince my real estate agent at the time, Amy, is the one that found this property, I told her that I would give her commission, regardless of whether we went through the auction or not. So, I also paid that commission right out of my profits. So that was also an additional expense.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAD:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E Taking into consideration all this expense, would you do this again? Was it worth it to sell your home backed by an NFT?\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ELA:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E I would say it depends. I did it because I wanted to prove the concept, I was comfortable knowing that theres a lot of uncertainty and we weren't sure how it's going to all end up. I knew my numbers.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAD:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E Would you recommend this method to your friends? Or should they still list their property the way we do now?\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ELA:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E The system is still clunky, this is just like the very beginning of the internet stages, I think you have to be the right candidate to be moving forward on the sale or purchase of a property as an NFT at this stage in the game. It's not where it's going to be five years from now. But where we're at right now, it's still clunky. And if you're going to do it, you're doing it because you want to be part of that development process.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAD:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E Did the person who bought your property buy it with crypto or dollars?\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ELA:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003EIt was with cryptocurrency, Ethereum.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAD:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E Did you liquidate that? If the price fluctuates, couldnt you lose a lot?\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ELA:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E Oh well, yeah, I am living thisI still have not liquidated, and I have lost a significant amount of money because I have not liquidated. So, at the time, there's a lot of talk about using stablecoins for real estate transactions and that probably will be beneficial, at least for the next few years. Because that way, at least the price of sale and everything kind of stands stays pretty stable throughout the process. For me, its not like that.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAD:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E So how much did you gain or lose?\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ELA:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E I gained like $30,000 from the day it sold to the next day. And I didn't liquidate because I was exhausted from everything. And then by the following day...the stuff that was going on with Russia came out in the news and crypto plummeted. I lost $60,000 or something like that. And this is why I'm saying this isn't for the faint of heart. And we're not at a finished product yet.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EBut we're getting there. Were kind of in the Wild West.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\"\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan class=\"font-body font-size-7;\"\u003E 2022 The Block Crypto, Inc. All Rights Reserved. This article is provided for informational purposes only. It is not offered or intended to be used as legal, tax, investment, financial, or other advice.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E";cq.primaryCategory={name:C,url:aZ};cq.categories=[{name:C,slug:ap,taxonomy:p},{name:"People",slug:"people",taxonomy:p}];cq.tags=[{name:"Interview",slug:"interview",taxonomy:k},{name:a_,slug:cc,taxonomy:k},{name:ct,slug:ct,taxonomy:k},{name:"real estate",slug:"real-estate",taxonomy:k}];cq.userHasAccess=o;cq.isSponsored=l;cq.sponsor=w;cq.wordCount=1099;cq.readingTime="5 min read";cq.customFields={label:cr,intro:cs};cu.id=136813;cu.url="https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Flinked\u002F136813\u002Fbiden-reportedly-set-to-order-multi-agency-study-push-on-crypto-cbdcs";cu.type=G;cu.title="Biden reportedly set to order multi-agency study push on crypto, CBDCs";cu.slug="biden-reportedly-set-to-order-multi-agency-study-push-on-crypto-cbdcs";cu.label=a;cu.published="2022-03-08T16:08:24-05:00";cu.publishedFormatted="March 8, 2022, 4:08PM EST";cu.byLines="by \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Fauthor\u002Fcatarina-moura\"\u003ECatarina Moura\u003C\u002Fa\u003E";cu.authors=[{id:8624,name:"Catarina Moura",thumbnail:w,url:"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Fauthor\u002Fcatarina-moura",slug:"catarina-moura"}];cu.thumbnail=a;cu.thumbnailCredit=a;cu.thumbnailCaption=a;cu.intro=a;cu.excerpt="President Joe Biden is expected to sign an executive order this week prompting different federal agencies to look into cryptocurrencies and examine how they should be regulated in the US, according to multiple reports. The bill could be signed as soon as Wednesday. It will not lay out specific policy, according to Politico. Instead, it […]";cu.body="\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EPresident Joe Biden is expected to sign an executive order this week prompting different federal agencies to look into cryptocurrencies and examine how they should be regulated in the US, according to multiple reports.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EThe bill could be signed as soon as Wednesday. It will not lay out specific policy, \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.politico.com\u002Fnews\u002F2022\u002F03\u002F07\u002Fbiden-executive-order-crypto-00014885\"\u003Eaccording to Politico\u003C\u002Fa\u003E. Instead, it will direct agencies to complete a series of studies over the coming months.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\"We could see a significant shift in policy in 180 days. This is a likely step toward creation of a central bank digital currency,\" a source familiar with the subject \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.reuters.com\u002Fbusiness\u002Ffinance\u002Fbiden-sign-executive-order-cryptocurrencies-this-week-source-2022-03-07\u002F?rpc=401&\"\u003Etold Reuters\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EAmong the other areas expected in the EO is a directive to the Treasury Department, Justice Department, Commerce Department and other agencies to review a possible central bank digital currency.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EThe Environmental Protection Agency and Office of Science and Technology Policy will also look into the potential impacts of crypto on the environment.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EOverall, the anticipated contents of the EO are less restrictive or severe than some commentators first feared when word of a Biden move on this front first emerged. Rather, the focus seems to be fact-finding by the responsible agencies, but more will become apparent once the actual text is made available for review.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EIn January, the Federal Reserve \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Flinked\u002F131051\u002Ffederal-reserve-publishes-long-awaited-central-bank-digital-currency-report\"\u003Epublished a report\u003C\u002Fa\u003E on central bank digital currencies, looking at the pros and cons of potentially adopting such a currency in the U.S. and how that would affect different players in the traditional finance system. \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EThe full document is available \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.federalreserve.gov\u002Fpublications\u002Fmoney-and-payments-discussion-paper.htm\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003Ehere\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EAs the Biden administration continues the path toward a possible future digital currency, many legislators have pushed for stricter regulations on crypto  \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Fpost\u002F136332\u002Fgovernments-are-on-high-alert-for-crypto-in-russian-sanctions-evasion-that-nobody-has-seen-yet\"\u003Eparticularly last week\u003C\u002Fa\u003E amid the invasion of Ukraine by Russia.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E";cu.primaryCategory={name:K,url:ck};cu.categories=[{name:ba,slug:cn,taxonomy:p},{name:K,slug:a$,taxonomy:p}];cu.tags=[{name:cv,slug:cv,taxonomy:k},{name:cw,slug:cw,taxonomy:k},{name:as,slug:as,taxonomy:k},{name:aq,slug:aq,taxonomy:k}];cu.userHasAccess=o;cu.isSponsored=l;cu.sponsor=w;cu.wordCount=284;cu.readingTime=J;cu.customFields={display_title:o};cx.id=136810;cx.url="https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Flinked\u002F136810\u002Fthree-men-charged-for-alleged-40-million-crypto-investment-fraud";cx.type=G;cx.title="Three men charged for alleged $40 million crypto investment fraud";cx.slug="three-men-charged-for-alleged-40-million-crypto-investment-fraud";cx.label=a;cx.published="2022-03-08T14:30:47-05:00";cx.publishedFormatted="March 8, 2022, 2:30PM EST";cx.byLines=cy;cx.authors=[{id:cz,name:bb,thumbnail:cA,url:cB,slug:cC}];cx.thumbnail="https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tbstat.com\u002Fwp\u002Fuploads\u002F2021\u002F04\u002F20210402_Cybercrime_Generic_G-1200x675.jpg";cx.thumbnailCredit=a;cx.thumbnailCaption=a;cx.intro=a;cx.excerpt="The three promised investors fixed returns on their investment, but in reality either pocketed the funds or used them to pay prior investors.";cx.body="\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EDwayne Golden, Gregory Aggesen and Marquis Demacking Egerton were charged Tuesday for financial crimes such as fraud and money laundering while operating three crypto endeavors called EmpowerCoin, ECoinPlus and Jet-Coin, which accumulated over $40 million from investors.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EAs per a \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.justice.gov\u002Fusao-edny\u002Fpr\u002Fowners-and-operators-online-cryptocurrency-companies-indicted-defrauding-investors\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003Erelease\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E from the Department of Justice, the three charged allegedly promised investors fixed returns on their crypto investments through overseas crypto trading. Prosecutors say the three either pocketed the funds or used them to pay prior investors.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EAnother man named William White allegedly conspired with Golden and Aggesen to obstruct justice and tamper with evidence during the investigations.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EAs alleged, the defendants engaged in a sophisticated scheme that preyed on unsuspecting investors nationwide with false promises of guaranteed returns and virtual currency trading opportunities, said United States Attorney for the Eastern District of New York Breon Peace in the statement. When the companies collapsed and their criminal conduct was about to be exposed, the defendants attempted to cover their tracks and destroy evidence.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EGolden, Aggesen and Egerton purportedly committed their crypto fraud starting in April of 2017, and the attempts to obstruct justice occurred from July 2017 to the present. \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EIf convicted, Golden, Aggesen, Egerton and White face up to 20 years in prison. \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E";cx.primaryCategory={name:cD,url:"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Fcategory\u002Fcrime"};cx.categories=[{name:cD,slug:bc,taxonomy:p},{name:cE,slug:"cryptocurrency",taxonomy:p}];cx.tags=[{name:bc,slug:bc,taxonomy:k},{name:as,slug:as,taxonomy:k},{name:cF,slug:cF,taxonomy:k},{name:cG,slug:cG,taxonomy:k},{name:"money laundering",slug:"money-laundering",taxonomy:k}];cx.userHasAccess=o;cx.isSponsored=l;cx.sponsor=w;cx.wordCount=200;cx.readingTime=J;cx.customFields={display_title:o};cI.id=133982;cI.url=at;cI.type=G;cI.title=X;cI.slug="world-wildlife-fund-pulls-conservation-focused-nft-project-after-backlash";cI.label=a;cI.published=bd;cI.publishedFormatted="February 11, 2022, 4:46PM EST";cI.byLines=cy;cI.authors=[{id:cz,name:bb,thumbnail:cA,url:cB,slug:cC}];cI.thumbnail="https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tbstat.com\u002Fwp\u002Fuploads\u002F2021\u002F05\u002F20210513_NFT_Generic_P-1200x675.jpg";cI.thumbnailCredit=b_;cI.thumbnailCaption=a;cI.intro=a;cI.excerpt=Y;cI.body="\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EThe World Wildlife Fund (WWF) in the United Kingdom \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.wwf.org.uk\u002Fupdates\u002Fnft-statement\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003Eannounced\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E on its website that it wouldnt continue a project designed to fund conservation work through non-fungible token (NFT) sales.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EWe thank all of those who have generously supported our conservation work by purchasing NFTs, the WWF UK wrote. We have now agreed with our partners to bring this trial to a close this evening (Friday 4th February). We recognise that NFTs are a much debated issue and we all have lots to learn about this new market, which is why we will now fully assess the impact of this trial and reflect on how we can best continue to innovate to engage our supporters.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EThe launch was originally slated to occur on February 3. The NFTs represented 13 endangered animal species such as the giant panda, Galapagos penguin and cross river gorilla. The collection included about 7,900 NFTs, which corresponded to the actual number of living members of each species in the wild.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EThe NFTs cost between 0.05 ETH (about $150) to 0.25 ETH (about $750) to mint, according to the projects Discord, and were to be minted on Polygon, a scaling chain for the Ethereum blockchain.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EHowever, the UKs WWF pulled the mint early after experiencing immense user backlash. Some on Discord accused the WWF of greenwashing this project with half truths about side chains, citing the \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Fnews+\u002F107461\u002Fthe-carbon-footprint-of-nfts\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003Eenergy cost\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E of dirty ETH for NFTs.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EOthers on Twitter said, Even if this particular arrangement was eco-friendly (it isnt), youre still contributing to the widespread adoption of NFT use which is literally killing the planet and the animals youre purporting to protect.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003ESome did come to the WWF UKs defense. Had this been a physical canvas art sale for these animals I don't think anyone would have had an issue. But because it's digital art people were attacking it on twitter because they don't like and understand crypto. I think WWF were a bit ahead of the curve here, and probably poor marketing\u002Fhype around it, a Discord user wrote.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EThis is not the first time a branch of the WWF sold NFTs to benefit conservation efforts. As The Block previously \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theblockcrypto.com\u002Flinked\u002F121691\u002Fgermanys-world-wildlife-fund-to-sell-nfts-to-raise-money-for-endangered-species\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003Ereported\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E, WWF Germany sold NFTs corresponding to the actual numbers of endangered animals in October of 2021. readabilityObject.title: World Wildlife Fund pulls conservation-focused NFT project after backlash
readabilityObject.content:
February 11, 2022, 4:46PM EST    2 min read

advertisement

The World Wildlife Fund (WWF) in the United Kingdom announced on its website that it wouldnt continue a project designed to fund conservation work through non-fungible token (NFT) sales. 

We thank all of those who have generously supported our conservation work by purchasing NFTs, the WWF UK wrote. We have now agreed with our partners to bring this trial to a close this evening (Friday 4th February). We recognise that NFTs are a much debated issue and we all have lots to learn about this new market, which is why we will now fully assess the impact of this trial and reflect on how we can best continue to innovate to engage our supporters.

The launch was originally slated to occur on February 3. The NFTs represented 13 endangered animal species such as the giant panda, Galapagos penguin and cross river gorilla. The collection included about 7,900 NFTs, which corresponded to the actual number of living members of each species in the wild. 

The NFTs cost between 0.05 ETH (about $150) to 0.25 ETH (about $750) to mint, according to the projects Discord, and were to be minted on Polygon, a scaling chain for the Ethereum blockchain.

However, the UKs WWF pulled the mint early after experiencing immense user backlash. Some on Discord accused the WWF of greenwashing this project with half truths about side chains, citing the energy cost of dirty ETH for NFTs. 

Others on Twitter said, Even if this particular arrangement was eco-friendly (it isnt), youre still contributing to the widespread adoption of NFT use which is literally killing the planet and the animals youre purporting to protect.

Some did come to the WWF UKs defense. Had this been a physical canvas art sale for these animals I don't think anyone would have had an issue. But because it's digital art people were attacking it on twitter because they don't like and understand crypto. I think WWF were a bit ahead of the curve here, and probably poor marketing/hype around it, a Discord user wrote. 

This is not the first time a branch of the WWF sold NFTs to benefit conservation efforts. As The Block previously reported, WWF Germany sold NFTs corresponding to the actual numbers of endangered animals in October of 2021.
